fields.title: At the Cafe
fields.description: Learn to order drinks and snacks at a Spanish cafe. Perfect for travelers wanting to enjoy local coffee culture.

fields.title: Au Cafe
fields.description: Apprenez a commander des boissons et des collations dans un cafe francais.

fields.title: Ordering Coffee
fields.description: Listen to a customer ordering coffee and understand the main points.

steps.title: Listen to the conversation
steps.description: A customer is ordering at a cafe in Madrid. Listen carefully and try to understand what they order.

steps.question: What did the customer order to drink?
steps.explanation: The customer said 'Un cafe con leche, por favor' - a coffee with milk.

steps.correct_answer: Un cafe con leche (Coffee with milk)
steps.transcript:
Cliente: Hola, buenos dias.
Camarero: Buenos dias! Que desea?
Cliente: Un cafe con leche, por favor.
Camarero: Muy bien. Algo mas?
Cliente: No, gracias. Cuanto es?
Camarero: Son dos euros cincuenta.
Cliente: Aqui tiene. Gracias.
Camarero: Gracias a usted!
steps.translation:
Customer: Hello, good morning.
Waiter: Good morning! What would you like?
Customer: A coffee with milk, please.
Waiter: Very well. Anything else?
Customer: No, thank you. How much is it?
Waiter: That's two euros fifty.
Customer: Here you go. Thank you.
Waiter: Thank you!

steps.question: How much did the coffee cost?
steps.explanation: The waiter said 'Son dos euros cincuenta' - that's 2.50 euros.

steps.tip: In Spanish, prices are often said as 'dos euros cincuenta' (two euros fifty) rather than 'dos con cincuenta'.

fields.title: Ordering a Snack
fields.description: Listen to someone ordering food at the cafe.

steps.title: Listen to the conversation
steps.description: A customer is ordering a snack. What do they choose?

steps.question: What snack did the customer order?
steps.explanation: The customer ordered 'una tostada con tomate' - toast with tomato.

steps.transcript:
Cliente: Perdon, tienen algo para comer?
Camarero: Si, tenemos tostadas, croissants, y bocadillos.
Cliente: Una tostada con tomate, por favor.
Camarero: Perfecto, ahora se la traigo.
steps.translation:
Customer: Excuse me, do you have anything to eat?
Waiter: Yes, we have toast, croissants, and sandwiches.
Customer: Toast with tomato, please.
Waiter: Perfect, I'll bring it right away.

key_phrases.english: do you have anything to eat?

fields.title: Commander un cafe
fields.description: Ecoutez un client commander un cafe et comprenez les points principaux.

steps.title: Ecoutez la conversation
steps.description: Un client commande dans un cafe parisien. Ecoutez attentivement.

steps.question: Qu'est-ce que le client a commande?
steps.explanation: Le client a dit 'Un cafe creme, s'il vous plait'.

steps.transcript:
Client: Bonjour!
Serveur: Bonjour! Qu'est-ce que je vous sers?
Client: Un cafe creme, s'il vous plait.
Serveur: Tres bien. Ce sera tout?
Client: Oui, merci. C'est combien?
Serveur: Trois euros cinquante.
Client: Voila. Merci!
Serveur: Merci a vous!
steps.translation:
Customer: Hello!
Waiter: Hello! What can I get you?
Customer: A coffee with cream, please.
Waiter: Very well. Will that be all?
Customer: Yes, thank you. How much is it?
Waiter: Three euros fifty.
Customer: Here you go. Thank you!
Waiter: Thank you!
